unnormalised: Mumbai landlords, listen up! Gone are the days of vague rental agreements scribbled on scrap paper. It's 2024, and things are getting serious!
normalised: Mumbai landlords, listen up! Gone are the days of vague rental agreements scribbled on scrap paper. It's two thousand and twenty four, and things are getting serious!

unnormalised: Property experts, like Dr. Sharma from the Real Estate Institute of India, are urging tenants and owners alike to get comprehensive agreements drafted. Think beyond just the monthly rent (Rs. 25,000 in Bandra, anyone?).
normalised: Property experts, like Doctor Sharma from the R E I I, are urging tenants and owners alike to get comprehensive agreements drafted. Think beyond just the monthly rent (rupee twenty five thousand in Bandra, anyone?).

unnormalised: These days, agreements need to cover everything - from pet policies (can Mrs. Iyer keep her Persian cat, Mittens?) to maintenance charges.
normalised: These days, agreements need to cover everything - from pet policies (can Mistress Iyer keep her Persian cat, Mittens?) to maintenance charges.

unnormalised: Who pays for that leaky tap, or the annual Diwali whitewash? Specify it ALL!
normalised: Who pays for that leaky tap, or the annual Diwali whitewash? Specify it ALL!

unnormalised: And forget those shady agreements notarized for Rs. 100. Get it legally registered. It might cost a bit more upfront, but itâ€™ll save you a mountain of headaches later.
normalised: And forget those shady agreements notarized for rupee one hundred. Get it legally registered. It might cost a bit more upfront, but it will save you a mountain of headaches later.

unnormalised: Plus, clearly define the 'lock-in' period. Nobody wants a tenant vanishing after 3 months leaving you searching for a new one!
normalised: Plus, clearly define the 'lock-in' period. Nobody wants a tenant vanishing after three months leaving you searching for a new one!

unnormalised: Standard rental rates in Bangalore for a 2BHK apartment around Indiranagar are roughly Rs. 30,000 for 1000 sq ft. Don't let ambiguity turn your rental property into a legal jungle.
normalised: Standard rental rates in Bangalore for a two B H K apartment around Indiranagar are roughly rupee thirty thousand for one thousand square feet. Do not let ambiguity turn your rental property into a legal jungle.
